definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: terror, only Ezek.; abs. ´[[ח]] Ez Eze 32:23, but Co rds. [[חִתִּיתָם]] (with LXX and v:Eze 32:24, v:Eze 32:26); cstr. id. Eze 32:27; sf. [[חתיתו]] Eze 32:32 Kt (> [[חִתִּיתִי]] Qr); [[חִתִּיתָם]] Eze 32:24 + 2 t.+ Eze 26:17 (rd. [[חִתִּיתָהּ]], with LXX Ew Co, see VB), Eze 32:30 (rd. [[חַתִּים]], v. II. [[חת]]);—terror, caused by powerful cities, nations, kings, etc.: usu. c. sf. obj. genit. Ez Eze 26:17 (of Tyre); elsewh. only Ez Eze 32: v:Eze 32:27 ([[גִּבּוֹרִים]] ´[[ח]], SyrVer Co [[גבור תם]] ´[[ח]]), v:Eze 32:30 ([[חִתִּיתָם]], but rd. [[חַתִּים]], v. supr.); esp. in phr. [[בארץ]] ´[[נׇתַן ח]] [[חַיִּים]] cause one's terror (terror of oneself) in the land of the living v:Eze 32:23, v:Eze 32:24, v:Eze 32:25 (del. LXX Co), v:Eze 32:26, v:Eze 32:32.—[[חִתִּית]] Ez Eze 16:3, Eze 16:45 v. [[חִתִּי]] sub [[חֵת]] supr. p. 366.
